core.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.map.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapFacade

    class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements MapFacade
    The Map implements all MapFacade operations.

    Map holds a 2 dimensional boolean array with the information whether a point [x][y] is passable or not. Map holds xDim,yDim as the dimension of this array.

    Map implements getXDim,getYDim by returning the xDim,yDim attribute.

    Map implements isPassable(coordinate) by looking up whether the array field with the same x,y values as the coordinate is true or false.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Patrick Loka
    See Also:
    MapFacade, MapController, MapFactory

      A valid implementation returns the maximum y-value of all known vectors

      • isPassable

        public boolean isPassable(Vector coordinate)
        Checks whether a vector is passable or not

        A valid implementation returns only true, iff the vector is explicit marked as passable
        Implementation: Looks up the value of coordinate in map array and returns value. Returns false if coordinate is no valid input for map array.
        Specified by:
        isPassable in interface MapFacade
        Parameters:
        coordinate - point to check whether it is allowed to pass or not
        Returns:
        value of coordinate in map array or false.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Map

      • switchPassable

        void switchPassable(Vector coordinate)
             throws InvalidCoordinateException
        Switches the passable state in map array of a given point. After running this method, a given passable field becomes unpassable and an given unpassable field becomes passable. If coordinate is no valid input for map array, an InvalidCoordinateException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - Point where passable state should be switched.
        Throws:
        InvalidCoordinateException - Thrown if coordinate is no valid input for map array.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        MapController, MapFacade

      • save

        void save(java.io.File file)
        Saves the current state of the Map instance as .map file.
        Parameters:
        file - filename of the file the map should be saved. To generate a valid file it should be type .map.
        Since:
        1.0
